intro: Dichapetalum griffithii, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
